column5: JOHANNESBURG Turkish mobile phone company Turkcell has taken to a South African court with its $4.2 billion lawsuit against rival MTN Group  alleging it was the victim of corruption and bribery that caused it to lose a contract in Iran.

column4: UPDATE 3-Turkcell sues MTN in South Africa for $4.2 bln in Iran damages
column5: * MTN says case has no legal merit   (Adds lawsuit details)

column4: Turkcell claims damages of $4.2 bln in S.Africa suit against MTN
column5: JOHANNESBURG  Nov 27 Turkish mobile operator Turkcell is claiming damages of at least $4.2 billion against rival MTN Group  which it alleges used "corruption and bribery" to win a mobile licence in Iran.

column4: Turkcell says opens lawsuit against MTN in South African court
column5: ISTANBUL  Nov 27 Turkish mobile phone company Turkcell said it has opened a lawsuit in South Africa against rival telecoms company MTN Group seeking damages for losses that Turkcell said it had incurred.

column4: UPDATE 1-W&T says regulatory notices may affect Gulf of Mexico ops
column5: Nov 27 U.S. oil and gas producer W&T Offshore Inc said it had recently received notices from U.S. government regulators related to environmental issues that could affect some of its  operations on federal oil and gas leases in the Gulf of Mexico.

column4: PRECIOUS-Gold falls after strong U.S. labor data; platinum falls
column5: * Drop in U.S. jobless claims stirs ideas of Fed tapering     * Platinum hits four-month low on technical selling     * China's imports from Hong Kong highest in seven months     * Coming up: U.S. markets shut on Thursday   (Adds trader comment  updates market activity)     By Frank Tang and Clara Denina      NEW YORK/LONDON  Nov 27 Gold fell on Wednesday  erasing initial gains  as a drop in U.S. jobless claims supported expectations the Federal Reserve will soon scale back its monet
